qas.question: How did the leader of Kiev gain political control?

answers.text: Due to the expansion of trade

qas.question: From what did this new princedom emerge from?

answers.text: from a coalition of traditional patriarchic family communes

qas.question: What type of government came from the coalition of traditional patriachic family?
What caused the decline of Kiev political power?
What emerged from a traditional matriarchal family communes?

plausible_answers.text: in an effort to increase the applicable workforce and expand the productivity of the land

qas.question: Why did the patriarchic family communes not band together?
What became smaller with am emphasis on family holdings?

context: <a0_0>Due to the <b3_0>expansion of trade<b3_0/><a0_0/> and its geographical proximity, Kiev became the most important trade centre and chief among the communes; therefore the leader of Kiev gained political "control" over the surrounding areas. This <b4_0>princedom<b4_0/> emerged <a1_0>from a coalition of traditional patriarchic family communes<a1_0/> banded together <b5_0>in an effort to increase the applicable workforce and expand the productivity of the land<b5_0/>. This union developed the first major cities in the Rus' and was the <a2_0>first notable form of self-government<a2_0/>. As these <b6_0>communes<b6_0/> became larger, the emphasis was taken off the family holdings and placed on the territory that surrounded. This shift in ideology became known as the verv'.
